verse_commentaries.commentary: Opens with divine beings worship command - striking in monotheistic context. The double imperative 'hāḇû' creates liturgical urgency. LXX translation is garbled, suggesting textual/interpretive difficulties even in antiquity.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Supports divine council polemic framework from thesis

verse_commentaries.commentary: Escalates from 'give glory' to 'bow down' - worship hierarchy. The phrase 'glory of his name' is unusual - name as repository of glory. 'Holy splendor' could mean divine splendor or human holy garments.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Sets liturgical framework for cosmic worship scene

verse_commentaries.commentary: First 'voice of LORD' launches sevenfold pattern. 'God of glory' is rare epithet. The verb 'thunders' anthropomorphizes divine action. Waters framing (regular + mighty waters) creates inclusio.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Begins storm-god appropriation from Baal mythology

verse_commentaries.commentary: Staccato rhythm builds intensity - shortest complete thought. Perfect parallelism of 'power/majesty' creates balanced emphasis. Abstract qualities made concrete through 'voice' medium.
figurative_analysis: voice as vehicle for divine attributes
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Continues systematic appropriation of storm-god attributes

verse_commentaries.commentary: Geographic specificity emerges - Lebanon cedars. Violent verb 'breaks/shatters' repeated for emphasis. Cedars symbolize strength, their destruction shows ultimate power.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Geographic specificity challenges Baal's territorial claims

verse_commentaries.commentary: Mountains 'skip like calves' - playful, almost whimsical imagery contrasts with destruction. Sirion (Hermon) paired with Lebanon. Animal imagery (calf, wild ox) domesticates cosmic forces.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Shows YHWH's power over specific Canaanite sacred mountains

verse_commentaries.commentary: Craftsman imagery - voice 'hews' flames like stone cutting. Lightning as divine craftsmanship. Shortest verse creates dramatic pause before geographical expansion.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Lightning as divine weapon against Baal's storm claims

verse_commentaries.commentary: Geographic shift to wilderness of Kadesh - south from Lebanon/Hermon. 'Writhe/convulse' suggests birth pangs or fear. Creates north-south axis of divine power.
figurative_analysis: wilderness as living entity in labor
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Extends YHWH's territorial dominion beyond Canaan proper

verse_commentaries.commentary: Birth imagery with deer - feminine animals giving birth prematurely. Sudden shift to temple where 'everything says Glory!' creates liturgical climax. Forest stripping suggests violent wind.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Climaxes with universal recognition of YHWH's supremacy

verse_commentaries.commentary: 'The Flood' (mabbul) - definite article suggests THE flood of Noah. Past tense 'sat' with present 'sits' creates temporal bridge. Kingship emerges from chaos mastery.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Establishes YHWH's eternal kingship over cosmic chaos

verse_commentaries.commentary: Dramatic shift from cosmic to covenantal - 'his people' first appears. Peace (shalom) contrasts with violent storm. Blessing structure concludes psalm liturgically.
figurative_analysis: storm power transformed to protective strength
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Transforms appropriated storm power into covenantal blessing

thematic_threads: Sevenfold 'voice of LORD' creates liturgical completeness - ritual magic number
Geographic progression: cosmic waters → Lebanon/Sirion → Kadesh → temple - territorial mapping
Rhetorical movement: cosmic summons → natural devastation → liturgical response → eternal kingship → covenantal peace
Imagery progression: divine beings → destructive power → playful animals → birth pangs → universal worship
Temporal complexity: present imperatives, ongoing storm description, past flood reference, eternal kingship, future blessing
synthesis_notes:
LEXICON: Rare storm vocabulary (חֹצֵ֗ב, יְחוֹלֵ֣ל), divine epithets (אֵֽל־הַכָּב֥וֹד), geographic terms (שִׂרְיֹ֗ן, מִדְבַּ֥ר קָדֵֽשׁ)
CONCORDANCE: Track 'mabbul' usage, 'voice of LORD' formula variations, 'sons of gods' occurrences
FIGURATIVE: Animal imagery for cosmic forces, birth metaphors, craftsman language for divine action
COMMENTARY: Verses with textual difficulties (v.1 LXX, v.6 'skip', v.9 temple location, v.10 flood reference)
